intro: Verbascum jordanicum, commonly known as Jordanian mullein, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, fuzzy leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, often found in rocky or arid environments. Verbascum jordanicum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in herbal medicine.
